title: Homebase confirms date of new UK opening - at site of former store
description: The DIY and garden retailer struck a deal with The Range owner CDS after collapsing into administration.
content:
Homebase has confirmed the exact date of a brand new opening in the UK that will be based at the site of a former Homebase store. The DIY and garden retailer has been opening new Garden Centres by Homebase inside The Range stores throughout the year after collapsing into administration at the end of 2024. Homebase was forced to call in administrators last November and later struck a deal with retail group CDS, which owns The Range, to save some of its stores. CDS snapped up 70 Homebase branches as part of the deal, saving around 1,600 jobs, while rival DIY chain B&Q took control of five branches and a further four have since been transformed into Wickes. Homebase has already opened more than 200 garden centres inside selected The Range stores so far and now another new opening is about to open its doors, but this time it will be inside a former Homebase unit.

The retailer has confirmed its latest garden centre will open on Friday, August 15, and will be based in the former Homebase unit at Enterprise Retail Park in Bradford, West Yorkshire. The new site will be open to customers from 9am and those who visit on the opening day will have the chance to snap up some exclusive offers and goodie bags. Announcing the opening date in a post on Facebook today, Homebase said: "1 WEEK TO GO! We’re so excited to be opening another 'Garden Centres by Homebase' in the former Homebase unit at Enterprise Retail Park, Eccleshill. "Save the Date: Friday 15th August 2025 at 9am! Expect exclusive offers, goodie bags for the first in the queue, and a first look at everything Garden Centres by Homebase has to offer! “Find your local Garden Centre by Homebase here."

The new opening comes after Homebase recently announced it had officially opened more than 50 brand new garden centres in The Range stores across the UK and Ireland in May this year. Each location provides shoppers with a selection of premium plants and garden accessories to help transform outdoor spaces. The openings come alongside the launch of ‘Kitchens by Homebase’ in selected stores and a new Homebase Bathstore is due to be coming soon. Homebase said: “A massive THANK YOU for all the support you’ve shown us so far in 2025. Stay tuned – more Homebase Hot News is on the way!”
summary: Homebase has confirmed the date of its new opening in the UK, which will be based at the site of a former Homebase store. The retailer has been opening Garden Centres by Homebase inside The Range stores throughout the year following its collapse into administration in 2024. Homebase was forced to call in administrators in November and later struck a deal with retail group CDS, which owns The Range, to save some of its stores. CDS purchased 70 Homebase branches and saved around 1,600 jobs, while rival DIY chain B&Q took control of five branches. The new garden centre will open on August 15, with customers expected to receive exclusive offers and goodie bags on the opening day.
shortSummary: Homebase will open its latest Garden Centres by Homebase in Bradford on Friday 15, August 2025, at the site of a former Homebase store.

This follows the retailer's strategy of launching 'Garden Centres by Homebase' within The Range stores after its administration in late 2024.
